message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

The paper deals with the use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for visual recognition tasks, specifically few-shot segmentation. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel architecture to remove texture bias, which involves modifying the feature space, and uses a bi-directional convolutional long-short-term-memory to merge the multi scale-space representations. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE) sub-categories. Finally, the paper performs experiments on two well-known few-shot segmentation benchmarks, which suggests that it may also fall under the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
